<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At January&#160;30, 2009, Dell held investments in 160 debt
    securities that had fair values below their carrying values for
    a period of less than 12&#160;months and 11 debt securities that
    had fair values below their carrying values for a period of
    12&#160;months or more. The unrealized losses are due to changes
    in interest rates and are expected to be recovered over the
    contractual term of the instruments. The unrealized loss of
    $10&#160;million has been recorded in other comprehensive income
    (loss) as Dell believes that the investments are not
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporarily</FONT>
    impaired.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell periodically reviews its investment portfolio to determine
    if any investment is
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporarily</FONT>
    impaired due to changes in credit risk or other potential
    valuation concerns. During Fiscal 2009 Dell recorded an
    $11&#160;million
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporary</FONT>
    impairment loss. Factors considered in determining whether a
    loss is
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporary</FONT>
    include the length of time and extent to which fair value has
    been less than the cost basis, the financial condition and
    near-term prospects of the investee, previous
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporary</FONT>
    impairment, and our intent and ability to hold the investment
    for a period of time sufficient to allow for any anticipated
    recovery in market value. The investments
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">other-than-temporarily</FONT>
    impaired during Fiscal 2009 were asset-backed securities and
    were impaired due to severe price degradation or price
    degradation over an extended period of time, rise in delinquency
    rates and general credit enhancement declines.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The following table summarizes Dell&#146;s gains and losses on
    investments recorded in investment and other income:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 10%">
<TABLE border="0" width="90%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
<!-- Table Width Row BEGIN -->
<TR style="font-size: 1pt" valign="bottom">
    <TD width="62%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=01 type=maindata -->
    <TD width="2%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=lead -->
    <TD width="8%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=02 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=lead -->
    <TD width="8%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=body -->
    <TD width="1%" align="left">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=03 type=hang1 -->
    <TD width="3%">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=gutter -->
    <TD width="1%" align="right">&nbsp;</TD>	<!-- colindex=04 type=lead -->

</TR>
<!-- Table Width Row END -->

    <BR>
    64

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Foreign
    Currency Instruments</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As part of its risk management strategy, Dell uses derivative
    instruments, primarily forward contracts and options, to hedge
    certain foreign currency exposures. Dell&#146;s objective is to
    offset gains and losses resulting from these exposures with
    gains and losses on the derivative contracts used to hedge them,
    thereby reducing volatility of earnings and protecting fair
    values of assets and liabilities. Dell applies hedge accounting
    based upon the criteria established by SFAS&#160;133, whereby
    Dell designates its derivatives as fair value hedges or cash
    flow hedges. Dell estimates the fair values of derivatives based
    on quoted market prices or pricing models using current market
    rates and records all derivatives in the Consolidated Statements
    of Financial Position at fair value.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Cash Flow
    Hedges</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell uses a combination of forward contracts and options
    designated as cash flow hedges to protect against the foreign
    currency exchange rate risks inherent in its forecasted
    transactions denominated in currencies other than the
    U.S.&#160;dollar. The risk of loss associated with purchased
    options is limited to premium amounts paid for the option
    contracts. The risk of loss associated with forward contracts is
    equal to the exchange rate differential from the time the
    contract is entered into until the time it is settled. These
    contracts typically expire in 12&#160;months or less. For
    derivative instruments that are designated and qualify as cash
    flow hedges, Dell records the effective portion of the gain or
    loss on the derivative instrument in accumulated other
    comprehensive income (loss) as a separate component of
    stockholders&#146; equity and reclassifies these amounts into
    earnings in the period during which the hedged transaction is
    recognized in earnings. Dell reports the effective portion of
    cash flow hedges in the same financial statement line item,
    within earnings, as the changes in value of the hedged item.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    For foreign currency option and forward contracts designated as
    cash flow hedges, Dell assesses hedge effectiveness both at the
    onset of the hedge as well as at the end of each fiscal quarter
    throughout the life of the derivative. Dell measures hedge
    ineffectiveness by comparing the cumulative change in the fair
    value of the hedge contract with the cumulative change in the
    fair value of the hedged item, both of which are based on
    forward rates. Dell recognizes any ineffective portion of the
    hedge, as well as amounts not included in the assessment of
    effectiveness, currently in earnings as a component of
    investment and other income, net. Hedge ineffectiveness for cash
    flow hedges was not material for Fiscal 2009, 2008, and 2007.
    During Fiscal 2009, 2008, and 2007, Dell did not discontinue any
    cash flow hedges that had a material impact on Dell&#146;s
    results of operations as substantially all forecasted foreign
    currency transactions were realized in Dell&#146;s actual
    results.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Changes in the aggregate unrealized net gain (loss) of
    Dell&#146;s cash flow hedges that are recorded as a component of
    comprehensive income (loss), net of tax, are presented in the
    table below. Dell expects to reclassify substantially all of the
    unrealized net gain recorded in accumulated other comprehensive
    income (loss) at January&#160;30, 2009, into earnings during the
    next fiscal year, providing an offsetting economic impact
    against the settlement of the underlying transactions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 10%">
<TABLE border="0" width="90%" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Other
    Foreign Currency Derivative Instruments</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell uses forward contracts to hedge monetary assets and
    liabilities, primarily receivables and payables, denominated in
    a foreign currency. The change in the fair value of these
    instruments represents a natural hedge as their gains and losses
    offset the changes in the underlying fair value of the monetary
    assets and liabilities due to movements in currency exchange
    rates. These contracts generally
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    65
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>

<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    expire in three months or less. These contracts are not
    designated as hedges under SFAS&#160;133, and therefore, the
    change in the instrument&#146;s fair value is recognized
    currently in earnings as a component of investment and other
    income, net.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    financial instruments and the related net asset or liability was
    as follows:

</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Commercial
    Paper</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell has a commercial paper program with a supporting senior
    unsecured revolving credit facility that allows Dell to obtain
    favorable short-term borrowing rates. The commercial paper
    program and related revolving credit facility were increased
    from $1.0&#160;billion to $1.5&#160;billion on April&#160;4,
    2008. Dell pays facility commitment fees at rates based upon
    Dell&#146;s credit rating. Unless extended, $500&#160;million
    expires on April&#160;3, 2009, and $1.0&#160;billion expires on
    June&#160;1, 2011. The credit facility requires compliance with
    conditions that must be satisfied prior to any borrowing, as
    well as ongoing compliance with specified affirmative and
    negative covenants, including maintenance of a minimum interest
    coverage ratio. Amounts outstanding under the facility may be
    accelerated for typical defaults, including failure to pay
    principal or interest, breaches of covenants, non-payment of
    judgments or debt obligations in excess of $200&#160;million,
    occurrence of a change of control, and certain bankruptcy
    events. There were no events of default as of January&#160;30,
    2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At January&#160;30, 2009, there was $100&#160;million
    outstanding under the commercial paper program and no
    outstanding advances under the related revolving credit
    facilities. The weighted-average interest rate on these
    outstanding short-term borrowings was 0.19%. At February&#160;1,
    2008, there were no outstanding advances under the commercial
    paper program or the related credit facility. Dell uses the
    proceeds of the program for short-term liquidity needs.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">India
    Credit Facilities</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell India Pvt Ltd. (&#147;Dell India&#148;), Dell&#146;s
    wholly-owned subsidiary, maintains unsecured short-term credit
    facilities with Citibank N.A. Bangalore Branch India
    (&#147;Citibank India&#148;) that provide a maximum capacity of
    $30&#160;million to fund&#160;Dell India&#146;s working capital
    and import buyers&#146; credit needs. The capacity increased
    from $30&#160;million to $55&#160;million on August&#160;6,
    2008. The incremental $25&#160;million line of credit expired on
    December&#160;31, 2008, and was not renewed. Financing is
    available in both Indian Rupees and foreign currencies. The
    borrowings are extended on an unsecured basis based on
    Dell&#146;s guarantee to Citibank N.A. Citibank India can cancel
    the facilities in whole or in part without prior notice, at
    which time any amounts owed under the facilities will become
    immediately due and payable. Interest on the outstanding loans
    is charged monthly and is calculated based on Citibank
    India&#146;s internal cost of funds plus 0.25%. At
    January&#160;30, 2009, and February&#160;1, 2008, outstanding
    advances from Citibank India totaled $12&#160;million and
    $23&#160;million, respectively, and are included in short-term
    debt on Dell&#146;s Consolidated Statement of Financial
    Position. There have been no events of default.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    66
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    During Fiscal 2009, Dell Inc. issued and sold debt comprising
    $600&#160;million aggregate principal amount due 2013 with a
    fixed interest rate of 4.70% (&#147;2013 Notes&#148;),
    $500&#160;million aggregate principal amount due 2018 with a
    fixed interest rate of 5.65% (&#147;2018 Notes&#148;), and
    $400&#160;million aggregate principal amount due 2038 with a
    fixed interest rate of 6.50%&#160;Notes (&#147;2038
    Notes&#148;), and together with the 2013 Notes and the 2018
    Notes, (&#147;Notes&#148;). The Notes are unsecured obligations
    and rank equally with Dell&#146;s existing and future unsecured
    senior indebtedness. The Notes effectively rank junior to all
    indebtedness and other liabilities, including trade payables, of
    Dell&#146;s subsidiaries. The net proceeds from the offering of
    the Notes were approximately $1.5&#160;billion after payment of
    expenses of the offering. The estimated fair value of the
    long-term debt was approximately $1.5&#160;billion at
    January&#160;30, 2009, compared to a carrying value of
    $1.5&#160;billion at that date.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Notes were issued pursuant to an Indenture dated as of
    April&#160;17, 2008 (&#147;Indenture&#148;), between Dell and a
    trustee. The Indenture contains customary events of default with
    respect to the Notes, including failure to make required
    payments, failure to comply with certain agreements or covenants
    and certain events of bankruptcy and insolvency. The Indenture
    also contains covenants limiting Dell&#146;s ability to create
    certain liens, enter into sale-and-leaseback transactions and
    consolidate or merge with, or convey, transfer or lease all or
    substantially all of Dell&#146;s assets to, another person. The
    Notes will be redeemable, in whole or in part at any time, at
    Dell&#146;s option, at a &#147;make-whole premium&#148;
    redemption price calculated by Dell equal to the greater of
    (i)&#160;100% of the principal amount of the Notes to be
    redeemed; and (ii)&#160;the sum of the present values of the
    remaining scheduled payments of principal and interest thereon
    (not including any portion of such payments of interest accrued
    as of the date of redemption) discounted to the date of
    redemption on a semi-annual basis (assuming a
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">360-day</FONT> year
    consisting of twelve
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">30-day</FONT>
    months) at the Treasury Rate (as defined in the Indenture) plus
    35&#160;basis points, plus accrued interest thereon to the date
    of redemption.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The Senior Debentures generally contain no restrictive
    covenants, other than a limitation on liens on Dell&#146;s
    assets and a limitation on sale-and-leaseback transactions
    involving Dell property. Interest rate swap agreements were
    entered into concurrently with the issuance of the Senior
    Debentures to convert the fixed rate to a floating rate for a
    notional amount of $300&#160;million and were set to mature
    April&#160;15, 2028.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    67
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The floating rates were based on three-month London Interbank
    Offered Rates plus 0.79%. In January 2009, Dell terminated its
    interest rate swap contracts with notional amounts totaling
    $300&#160;million. Dell received $103&#160;million in cash
    proceeds from the swap terminations, which included
    $1&#160;million in accrued interest. These swaps had effectively
    converted its $300&#160;million, 7.10% fixed rate Senior
    Debentures due 2028 to variable rate debt. As a result of the
    swap terminations, the fair value of the terminated swaps are
    reported as part of the carrying value of the Senior Debentures
    and are amortized as a reduction of interest expense over the
    remaining life of the debt. The cash flows from the terminated
    swap contracts are reported as operating activities in the
    Consolidated Statement of Cash Flows.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of January&#160;30, 2009, there were no events of default for
    the Indenture and the Senior Debentures.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell&#146;s effective interest rate for the Senior Debentures
    was 4.57% for Fiscal 2009. The principal amount of the debt was
    $300&#160;million at January&#160;30, 2009. The estimated fair
    value of the long-term debt was approximately $294&#160;million
    at January&#160;30, 2009, compared to a carrying value of
    $400&#160;million at that date as a result of the termination of
    the interest rate swap agreements.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Prior to the termination of the interest rate swap contracts,
    the interest rate swaps qualified for hedge accounting treatment
    pursuant to SFAS&#160;No.&#160;133, <I>Accounting for Derivative
    Instruments and Hedging Activities, as amended</I>. Dell
    designated the issuance of the Senior Debentures and the related
    interest rate swap agreements as an integrated transaction. The
    changes in the fair value of the interest rate swaps were
    reflected in the carrying value of the interest rate swaps on
    the balance sheet. The carrying value of the debt on the balance
    sheet was adjusted by an equal and offsetting amount. The
    differential to be paid or received on the interest rate swap
    agreements was accrued and recognized as an adjustment to
    interest expense as interest rates changed.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    On April&#160;15, 2008, Dell repaid the principal balance of the
    1998 $200&#160;million 6.55% fixed rate senior notes (the
    &#147;Senior Notes&#148;) upon their maturity. Interest rate
    swap agreement related to the Senior Notes had a notional amount
    of $200&#160;million and also matured April&#160;15, 2008.
    Dell&#146;s effective interest rate for the Senior Notes, prior
    to repayment, was 4.03% for the first quarter of Fiscal 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In November 2008, Dell filed a shelf registration statement with
    the SEC, which provides Dell with the ability to issue
    additional term debt up to $1.5&#160;billion, subject to market
    conditions.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

    <TD>

</TD>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Income before income taxes included approximately
    $2.6&#160;billion, $3.2&#160;billion, and $2.6&#160;billion
    related to foreign operations in Fiscal 2009, 2008 and 2007
    respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The provision for income taxes consisted of the following:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Deferred tax assets and liabilities for the estimated tax impact
    of temporary differences between the tax and book basis of
    assets and liabilities are recognized based on the enacted
    statutory tax rates for the year in which Dell expects the
    differences to reverse. A valuation allowance is established
    against a deferred tax asset when it is more likely than not
    that the asset or any portion thereof will not be realized.
    Based upon all the available evidence including expectation of
    future taxable income, Dell has provided a valuation allowance
    of $31&#160;million related to state credit carryforwards, but
    determined that it will be able to realize the remainder of its
    deferred tax assets.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    68
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    As of January&#160;30, 2009, Dell has recorded $76&#160;million
    of deferred tax assets related to acquired net operating loss
    and credit carryforwards. The offset for recording the acquired
    net operating loss and credit carryforwards was $56&#160;million
    to goodwill and $20&#160;million to additional-paid-in-capital.
    Utilization of the acquired carryforwards is subject to
    limitations due to ownership changes, which may delay the
    utilization of a portion of the acquired carryforwards. The
    carryforwards for significant taxing jurisdictions expire
    beginning Fiscal 2017.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Deferred taxes have not been recorded on the excess book basis
    in the shares of certain foreign subsidiaries because these
    basis differences are not expected to reverse in the foreseeable
    future and are expected to be permanent in duration. These basis
    differences in the amount of approximately $9.9&#160;billion
    arose primarily from the undistributed book earnings of
    substantially all of the subsidiaries in which Dell intends to
    reinvest indefinitely. The basis differences could reverse
    through a sale of the subsidiaries or the receipt of dividends
    from the subsidiaries, as well as various other events. Net of
    available foreign tax credits, residual income tax of
    approximately $3.2&#160;billion would be due upon reversal of
    this excess book basis as of January&#160;30, 2009.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    69
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    A portion of Dell&#146;s operations is subject to a reduced tax
    rate or is free of tax under various tax holidays that expire in
    whole or in part during Fiscal 2010 through 2018. Many of these
    tax holidays and reduced tax rates may be extended when certain
    conditions are met or may be terminated early if certain
    conditions are not met. The income tax benefits attributable to
    the tax status of these subsidiaries were estimated to be
    approximately $338&#160;million ($0.17 per share) in Fiscal
    2009, $502&#160;million ($0.23 per share) in Fiscal 2008, and
    $282&#160;million ($0.13 per share) in Fiscal 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In March 2007, China announced a broad program to reform tax
    rates and incentives, effective January&#160;1, 2008, including
    the introduction of phased-in transition rules that could
    significantly alter the Chinese tax structure for
    U.S.&#160;companies operating in China. Clarification of the
    rules, which phase in higher statutory tax rates over a five
    year period, was issued in late Fiscal 2008. As a result, Dell
    increased the relevant deferred tax assets to reflect the
    enacted statutory rates for the year in which it expects the
    differences to reverse, which resulted in an additional tax
    benefit of $27&#160;million in Fiscal 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The effective tax rate differed from the statutory
    U.S.&#160;federal income tax rate as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 5%; margin-right: 5%">

<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD style="border-top: 3px double #000000">
&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>
&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The increase in Dell&#146;s Fiscal 2009 effective tax rate,
    compared to Fiscal 2008, is due primarily to an increased
    profitability mix in higher tax jurisdictions during Fiscal 2009
    as compared to Fiscal 2008. The increase in Dell&#146;s Fiscal
    2008 effective tax rate, compared to Fiscal 2007, is due to the
    tax related to accessing foreign cash and the nondeductibility
    of acquisition-related IPR&#038;D charges offset primarily by
    the increase of consolidated profitability in lower foreign tax
    jurisdictions during Fiscal 2008 as compared to Fiscal 2007.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell adopted FIN&#160;No.&#160;48, <I>Accounting for Uncertainty
    in Income Taxes&#160;&#151; an interpretation of FASB Statement
    No.&#160;109 </I>(&#147;FIN&#160;48&#148;) effective
    February&#160;3, 2007. FIN&#160;48 provides that a tax benefit
    from an uncertain tax position may be recognized in the
    financial statements only when it is more likely than not that
    the position will be sustained upon examination, including
    resolution of any related appeals or litigation processes, based
    on the technical merits and a consideration of the relevant
    taxing authority&#146;s widely understood administrative
    practices and precedents. Once the recognition threshold is met,
    the portion of the tax benefit that is recorded represents the
    largest amount of tax benefit that is greater than
    50&#160;percent likely to be realized upon settlement with a
    taxing authority. The cumulative effect of adopting FIN&#160;48
    was a $62&#160;million increase in tax liabilities and a
    corresponding decrease to the February&#160;2, 2007
    stockholders&#146; equity balance of which $59&#160;million
    related to retained earnings and $3&#160;million related to
    additional-paid-in-capital. In addition, consistent with the
    provisions of FIN&#160;48, Dell changed the classification of
    $1.1&#160;billion of income tax liabilities from current to
    non-current because payment of cash is not anticipated within
    one year of the balance sheet date. These non-current income tax
    liabilities are recorded in other
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    70
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->

    non-current liabilities in the Consolidated Statements of
    Financial Position. A reconciliation of the beginning and ending

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Fiscal 2009 reductions for tax positions of prior years in the
    table above include $163&#160;million of items that did not
    impact Dell&#146;s effective tax rate for Fiscal 2009. These
    items include foreign currency translation, withdrawal of
    positions expected to be taken for prior year tax filings, and a
    reduction that is included in the deferred tax asset valuation
    allowance at January&#160;30, 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Associated with the unrecognized tax benefits of
    $1.5&#160;billion at January&#160;30, 2009, are interest and
    penalties as well as $166&#160;million of offsetting tax
    benefits associated with estimated transfer pricing, the benefit
    of interest deductions, and state income tax benefits. The net
    amount of $1.8&#160;billion, if recognized, would favorably
    affect Dell&#146;s effective tax rate.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Interest and penalties related to income tax liabilities are
    included in income tax expense. The balance of gross accrued
    interest and penalties recorded in the Consolidated Statements
    of Financial Position at January&#160;30, 2009 and
    February&#160;1, 2008, was $400&#160;million and
    $288&#160;million, respectively. During Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal
    2008, $112&#160;million and $88&#160;million, respectively,
    related to interest and penalties were included in income tax
    expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell is currently under income tax audits in various
    jurisdictions, including the U.S.&#160;The tax periods open to
    examination by the major taxing jurisdictions to which Dell is
    subject include fiscal years 1997 through 2009. As a result of
    these audits, Dell maintains ongoing discussions and
    negotiations relating to tax matters with the taxing authorities
    in these various jurisdictions. Dell&#146;s U.S.&#160;Federal
    income tax returns for fiscal years 2004 through 2006 are under
    examination, and the Internal Revenue Service has proposed
    certain preliminary assessments primarily related to transfer
    pricing matters. Dell anticipates this audit will take several
    years to resolve and continues to believe that it has provided
    adequate reserves related to the matters under audit. However,
    should Dell experience an unfavorable outcome in this matter, it
    could have a material impact on its results of operations,
    financial position, or cash flows. Although the timing of income
    tax audit resolution and negotiations with taxing authorities
    are highly uncertain, Dell does not anticipate a significant
    change to the total amount of unrecognized income tax benefits
    within the next 12&#160;months.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell takes certain non-income tax positions in the jurisdictions
    in which it operates and has received certain non-income tax
    assessments in various jurisdictions. Dell is also involved in
    related non-income tax litigation matters in various
    jurisdictions. Dell believes its positions are supportable, a
    liability is not probable, and that it will ultimately prevail.
    However, significant judgment is required in determining the
    ultimate outcome of these matters. In the normal course of
    business, Dell&#146;s positions and conclusions related to its
    non-income taxes could be challenged and assessments may be
    made. To the extent new information is obtained and Dell&#146;s
    views on its positions, probable outcomes of assessments, or
    litigation changes, changes in estimates to Dell&#146;s accrued
    liabilities would be recorded in the period in which the
    determination is made.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    71
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="9%"></TD>
    <TD width="91%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;4&#160;&#151;&#160;</FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">CAPITALIZATION</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Preferred
    Stock</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Authorized Shares</I>&#160;&#151; Dell has the authority to
    issue five million shares of preferred stock, par value $.01 per
    share. At January&#160;30, 2009, and February&#160;1, 2008, no
    shares of preferred stock were issued or outstanding.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Redeemable
    Common Stock</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    In prior years, Dell inadvertently failed to register with the
    SEC the issuance of some shares under certain employee benefit
    plans. These shares were purchased by participants between
    March&#160;31, 2006, and April&#160;3, 2007. As a result,
    certain purchasers of securities pursuant to those plans may
    have had the right to rescind their purchases for an amount
    equal to the purchase price paid for the securities, plus
    interest from the date of purchase. Dell made a registered
    rescission offer to eligible plan participants effective as of
    August&#160;12, 2008. At February&#160;1, 2008, and
    February&#160;2, 2007, approximately 4&#160;million shares
    ($94&#160;million) and 5&#160;million shares
    ($111&#160;million), respectively, were classified outside
    stockholders&#146; equity because the redemption features were
    not within Dell&#146;s control. Prior to the effective date of
    the rescission offer, as participants sold shares in the open
    market, the shares held outside of stockholders&#146; equity
    were reclassified to common stock and capital in excess of
    $0.01&#160;par value, accordingly. These shares were treated as
    outstanding for financial reporting purposes. The registered
    rescission offer expired on September&#160;26, 2008, and
    payments of $29&#160;million under the offer have been
    substantially completed. Upon expiration of the rescission
    offer, all remaining redeemable shares were reclassified to
    within stockholders&#146; equity.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Common
    Stock</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Authorized Shares</I>&#160;&#151; At January&#160;30, 2009,
    Dell is authorized to issue 7.0&#160;billion shares of common
    stock, par value $.01 per share.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Share Repurchase Program</I>&#160;&#151; Dell has a share
    repurchase program that authorizes it to purchase shares of
    common stock in order to increase shareholder value and manage
    dilution resulting from shares issued under Dell&#146;s equity
    compensation plans. However, Dell does not currently have a
    policy that requires the repurchase of common stock in
    conjunction with stock-based payment arrangements. During Fiscal
    2009, Dell repurchased approximately 134&#160;million shares for
    an aggregate cost of approximately $2.9&#160;billion. At
    January&#160;30, 2009, Dell&#146;s remaining authorized amount
    for share repurchases was $4.5&#160;billion.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;5&#160;&#151;&#160;BENEFIT
    PLANS</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Description
    of the Plans</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Employee Stock Plans</I>&#160;&#151; Dell is currently
    issuing stock grants under the Dell Amended and Restated 2002
    Long-Term Incentive Plan (&#147;the 2002 Incentive Plan&#148;),
    which was approved by shareholders on December&#160;4, 2007.
    There are previous plans that have been terminated except for
    options previously granted under those plans that are still
    outstanding. These are all collectively referred to as the
    &#147;Stock Plans&#148;.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The 2002 Incentive Plan provides for the granting of stock-based
    incentive awards to Dell&#146;s employees and non-employee
    directors. Awards may be incentive stock options within the
    meaning of Section&#160;422 of the Internal Revenue Code,
    nonqualified stock options, restricted stock, or restricted
    stock units. There were approximately 313&#160;million,
    292&#160;million, and 271&#160;million shares of Dell&#146;s
    common stock available for future grants under the Stock Plans
    at January&#160;30, 2009, February&#160;1, 2008, and
    February&#160;2, 2007, respectively. To satisfy stock option
    exercises, Dell has a policy of issuing new shares as opposed to
    repurchasing shares on the open market.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Stock Option Agreements</I>&#160;&#151; The right to purchase
    shares pursuant to existing stock option agreements typically
    vests pro-rata at each option anniversary date over a three- to
    five-year period. The options, which are granted with option
    exercise prices equal to the fair market value of Dell&#146;s
    common stock on the date of grant, generally expire within ten
    to twelve years from the date of grant.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Restricted Stock Awards</I>&#160;&#151; Awards of restricted
    stock may be either grants of restricted stock, restricted stock
    units, or performance-based stock units that are issued at no
    cost to the recipient. For restricted stock grants, at the date
    of grant, the recipient has all rights of a stockholder, subject
    to certain restrictions on transferability and a risk of
    forfeiture. Restricted stock grants typically vest over a three-
    to seven-year period beginning on the date of grant. For
    restricted stock units, legal ownership of the shares is not
    transferred to the
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    72
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    employee until the unit vests, which is generally over a three-
    to five-year period. Dell also grants performance-based
    restricted stock units as a long-term incentive in which an
    award recipient receives shares contingent upon Dell achieving
    performance objectives and the employees&#146; continuing
    employment through the vesting period, which is generally over a
    three- to five-year period. Compensation expense recorded in
    connection with these performance-based restricted stock units
    is based on Dell&#146;s best estimate of the number of shares
    that will eventually be issued upon achievement of the specified
    performance criteria and when it becomes probable that certain
    performance goals will be achieved. The cost of these awards is
    determined using the fair market value of Dell&#146;s common
    stock on the date of the grant. Compensation expense for
    restricted stock awards with a service condition is recognized
    on a straight-line basis over the vesting term. Compensation
    expense for performance-based restricted stock awards is
    recognized on an accelerated multiple-award approach based on
    the most probable outcome of the performance condition.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Acceleration of Vesting of Options</I>&#160;&#151; On
    January&#160;23, 2009, Dell&#146;s Board of Directors approved
    the acceleration of the vesting of unvested
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;out-of-the-money&#148;</FONT>
    stock options (options that have an exercise price greater than
    the current market stock price) with exercise prices equal to or
    greater than $10.14 per share for approximately
    2,800&#160;employees holding options to purchase approximately
    21&#160;million shares of common stock. Dell concluded the
    modification to the stated vesting provisions was substantive
    after Dell considered the volatility of its share price and the
    exercise price of the amended options in relation to recent
    share values. Because the modification was considered
    substantive, the remaining unearned compensation expense of
    $104&#160;million was recorded as an expense in Fiscal 2009. The
    weighted-average exercise price of the options that were
    accelerated was $21.90.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Temporary Suspension of Option Exercises, Vesting of
    Restricted Stock Units, and Employee Stock Purchase Plan
    (&#147;ESPP&#148;) Purchases </I>&#151;&#160;As a result of
    Dell&#146;s inability to timely file its Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for Fiscal 2007, Dell suspended the exercise of employee stock
    options, the settlement of restricted stock units, and the
    purchase of shares under the ESPP on April&#160;4, 2007. Dell
    resumed allowing the exercise of employee stock options by
    employees and the settlement of restricted stock units on
    October&#160;31, 2007. The purchase of shares under the ESPP was
    not resumed as the plan was discontinued during the first
    quarter of Fiscal 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell decided to pay cash to current and former employees who
    held
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;in-the-money&#148;</FONT>
    stock options (options that have an exercise price less than the
    current market stock price) that expired during the period of
    unexercisability due to Dell&#146;s inability to timely file its
    Annual Report on
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">Form&#160;10-K</FONT>
    for Fiscal 2007. During Fiscal 2008, Dell made payments of
    approximately $107&#160;million, which were expensed, relating
    to
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    stock options that expired in the second and third quarters of
    Fiscal 2008.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 9pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">General
    Information</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Stock Option Activity</I>&#160;&#151; The following table
    summarizes stock option activity for the Stock Plans during
    Fiscal 2009:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 11%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=540 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="98%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(a)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">For options vested and expected to
    vest and options exercisable, the aggregate intrinsic value in
    the table above represents the total pre-tax intrinsic value
    (the difference between Dell&#146;s closing stock price on
    January&#160;30, 2009, and the exercise price multiplied by the
    number of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    options) that would have been received by the option holders had
    the holders exercised their options on January&#160;30, 2009.
    The intrinsic value changes based on changes in the fair market
    value of Dell&#146;s common stock.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <TD>    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(b)&#160;
    </FONT>
</TD>
    <TD align="left">    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">No options were
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    at January&#160;30, 2009.
    </FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    73

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 11%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=540 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(a)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">For options vested and expected to
    vest and options exercisable, the aggregate intrinsic value in
    the table above represents the total pre-tax intrinsic value
    (the difference between Dell&#146;s closing stock price on
    February&#160;1, 2008, and February&#160;2, 2007, respectively,
    and the exercise price multiplied by the number of
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">in-the-money</FONT>
    options) that would have been received by the option holders had
    the holders exercised their options on February&#160;1, 2008,
    and February&#160;2, 2007, respectively. The intrinsic value
    changes based on changes in the fair market value of Dell&#146;s
    common stock.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    74
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 11%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=540 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(a)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">Includes the $104&#160;million
    charge for the Fiscal 2009 acceleration of vesting of certain
    unvested and
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">&#147;out-of-the-money&#148;</FONT>
    stock options with exercise prices equal to or greater than
    $10.14 per share previously awarded under equity compensation
    plans.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>


<TR style="line-height: 3pt; font-size: 1pt"><TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(b)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">The total intrinsic value of
    options exercised represents the total pre-tax intrinsic value
    (the difference between the stock price at exercise and the
    exercise price multiplied by the number of options exercised)
    that was received by the option holders who exercised their
    options during the fiscal year.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At January&#160;30, 2009, approximately $1&#160;million of total
    unrecognized stock-based compensation expense, net of estimated
    forfeitures, related to stock options is expected to be
    recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately
    2.3&#160;years.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    At January&#160;30, 2009, $507&#160;million of unrecognized
    stock-based compensation expense, net of estimated forfeitures,
    related to non-vested restricted stock awards is expected to be
    recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately
    2.0&#160;years.

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Stock-based compensation in the table above includes
    $104&#160;million of expense for accelerated options and a
    reduction of $1&#160;million for the release of the accrual for
    expired stock options in Fiscal 2009 and $107&#160;million of
    cash expense in Fiscal 2008 for expired stock options, as
    previously discussed.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Stock-based compensation expense is based on awards expected to
    vest, reduced for estimated forfeitures. SFAS&#160;123(R)
    requires forfeitures to be estimated at the time of grant and
    revised, if necessary, in subsequent periods if actual
    forfeitures differ from those estimates.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <I><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Valuation
    Information</FONT></I>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    SFAS&#160;123(R) requires the use of a valuation model to
    calculate the fair value of stock option awards. Dell has
    elected to use the Black-Scholes option pricing model, which
    incorporates various assumptions, including volatility, expected
    term, and risk-free interest rates. The volatility is based on a
    blend of implied and historical volatility of Dell&#146;s common
    stock over the most recent period commensurate with the
    estimated expected term of Dell&#146;s stock options. Dell uses
    this blend of implied and historical volatility, as well as
    other economic data, because management believes such volatility
    is more representative of prospective trends. The expected term
    of an award is based on historical experience and on the terms
    and conditions of the stock awards granted to employees. The
    dividend yield of zero is based on the fact that Dell has never
    paid cash dividends and has no present intention to pay cash
    dividends.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    The weighted-average fair value of stock options and purchase
    rights under the employee stock purchase plan was determined
    based on the Black-Scholes option pricing model weighted for all
    grants utilizing the assumptions in the following table:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 10%">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV style="font-size: 1pt; margin-left: 0%; width: 11%;  align: left; border-bottom: 1pt solid #000000"></DIV><!-- callerid=999 iwidth=540 length=60 -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 3pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>



<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="2%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="97%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD valign="top">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">(a)
    </FONT></TD>
    <TD></TD>
    <TD valign="bottom">
    <FONT style="font-size: 8pt">No purchase rights were granted
    under the ESPP in Fiscal 2009 and Fiscal 2008 due to Dell
    suspending the ESPP on April&#160;4, 2007, and subsequently
    discontinuing the plan effective the first quarter of Fiscal
    2009 as a part of an overall assessment of its benefits strategy.
    </FONT></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>401(k) Plan</I>&#160;&#151; Dell has a defined contribution
    retirement plan (the &#147;401(k) Plan&#148;) that complies with
    Section&#160;401(k) of the Internal Revenue Code. Substantially
    all employees in the U.S.&#160;are eligible to participate in
    the 401(k) Plan. Effective January&#160;1, 2008, Dell
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    76
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always"><A HREF="#tocpage">Table of Contents</A></H5><P>

<DIV style="width: 94%; margin-left: 3%"><!-- BEGIN PAGE WIDTH -->

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">DELL
    INC.<BR>
    </FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="center" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTES&#160;TO
    CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS&#160;(Continued)</FONT></B>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 18pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    matches 100% of each participant&#146;s voluntary contributions,
    subject to a maximum contribution of 5% of the
    participant&#146;s compensation, and participants vest
    immediately in all Dell contributions to the 401(k) Plan. From
    January&#160;1, 2005, to December&#160;31, 2007, Dell matched
    100% of each participant&#146;s voluntary contributions, subject
    to a maximum contribution of 4% of the participant&#146;s
    compensation. Prior to January&#160;1, 2005, Dell matched 100%
    of each participant&#146;s voluntary contributions, subject to a
    maximum contribution of 3% of the participant&#146;s
    compensation. Dell&#146;s contributions during Fiscal 2009,
    2008, and 2007 were $93&#160;million, $76&#160;million, and
    $70&#160;million, respectively. Dell&#146;s contributions are
    invested according to each participant&#146;s elections in the
    investment options provided under the Plan. Investment options
    include Dell stock, but neither participant nor Dell
    contributions are required to be invested in Dell stock.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Deferred Compensation Plan</I>&#160;&#151; Dell has a
    nonqualified deferred compensation plan (the &#147;Deferred
    Compensation Plan&#148;) for the benefit of certain management
    employees and non-employee directors. The Deferred Compensation
    Plan permits the deferral of base salary and annual incentive
    bonus. The deferrals are held in a separate trust, which has
    been established by Dell to administer the Plan. The assets of
    the trust are subject to the claims of Dell&#146;s creditors in
    the event that Dell becomes insolvent. Consequently, the trust
    qualifies as a grantor trust for income tax purposes (i.e. a
    &#147;Rabbi Trust&#148;). In accordance with the provisions of
    EITF
    <FONT style="white-space: nowrap">No.&#160;97-14,</FONT>
    <I>Accounting for Deferred Compensation Arrangements Where
    Amounts Earned are Held in a Rabbi Trust and Invested</I>, the
    assets and liabilities of the Deferred Compensation Plan are
    presented in long-term investments and accrued and other
    liabilities in the Consolidated Statements of Financial
    Position, respectively. The assets held by the trust are
    classified as trading securities with changes recorded to
    investment and other income, net. These assets are valued at
    $73&#160;million and are disclosed in Note&#160;2 of Notes to
    Consolidated Financial Statements. Changes in the deferred
    compensation liability are recorded to compensation expense.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <I>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</I>&#160;&#151; Dell
    discontinued its shareholder approved employee stock purchase
    plan during the first quarter of Fiscal 2009. Prior to
    discontinuance, the ESPP allowed participating employees to
    purchase common stock through payroll deductions at the end of
    each three-month participation period at a purchase price equal
    to 85% of the fair market value of the common stock at the end
    of the participation period. Upon adoption of SFAS&#160;123(R)
    in Fiscal 2007, Dell began recognizing compensation expense for
    the 15% discount received by the participating employees. No
    common stock was issued under this plan in Fiscal 2009 or Fiscal
    2008 due to Dell suspending the ESPP on April&#160;4, 2007, and
    subsequently discontinuing the ESPP as part of an overall
    assessment of its benefits strategy. Common stock issued under
    ESPP totaled 6&#160;million shares in Fiscal 2007, and the
    weighted-average fair value of the purchase rights under the
    ESPP during Fiscal 2007 was $3.89.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 12pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

<TR>
    <TD width="8%"></TD>
    <TD width="92%"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">NOTE&#160;6&#160;&#151;
    </FONT></B>
</TD>
    <TD>
    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">FINANCIAL
    SERVICES</FONT></B>
</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial, Helvetica; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">

    <B><FONT style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times">Dell
    Financial Services L.L.C.</FONT></B>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell offers or arranges various financing options and services
    for its business and consumer customers in the U.S.&#160;through
    DFS. a wholly-owned subsidiary of Dell. DFS&#146;s key
    activities include the origination, collection, and servicing of
    customer receivables related to the purchase of Dell products.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    Dell utilizes DFS to facilitate financing for customers who
    elect to finance products sold by Dell. New financing
    originations, which represent the amounts of financing provided
    to customers for equipment and related software and services
    through DFS, were $4.5&#160;billion, $5.7&#160;billion, and
    $6.1&#160;billion, during the fiscal years ended
    January&#160;30, 2009, February&#160;1, 2008, and
    February&#160;2, 2007, respectively.
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt; font-size: 1pt">&nbsp;</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="margin-left: 0%; margin-right: 0%; text-indent: 0%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    CIT, formerly a joint venture partner of DFS, continues to have
    the right to purchase a percentage of new customer receivables
    facilitated by DFS until January&#160;29, 2010 (&#147;Fiscal
    2010&#148;). CIT&#146;s contractual funding right is up to 35%
    in Fiscal 2009 and up to 25% in Fiscal 2010. During Fiscal 2009
    CIT&#146;s funding percentage was approximately 34%. DFS
    services the receivables purchased by CIT. However, Dell&#146;s
    obligation related to the performance of the DFS originated
    receivables purchased by CIT is limited to the cash funded
    credit reserves established at the time of funding.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times; color: #000000; background: #FFFFFF">
    <BR>
    77
</DIV><!-- END PAGE WIDTH -->
<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
